snippet: After enduring huge recalls, a tsunami in Japan and a steep drop in sales because of slowing demand, Toyota said it was on pace to earn its biggest-ever annual profit in its fiscal year that ends in March.
abstract: Toyota, after enduring huge recalls, tsunami in Japan and steep drop in sales because of slowing demand, projects it will earn net income of $18.8 billion for its fiscal year that ends in March 2014, its biggest-ever annual profit.

byline.original: By HIROKO TABUCHI and BILL VLASIC
byline.contributor: Hiroko Tabuchi reported from Tokyo and Bill Vlasic from Detroit.

lead_paragraph: After enduring huge recalls, a tsunami in Japan and a steep drop in sales because of slowing demand, Toyota said it was on pace to earn its biggest-ever annual profit in its fiscal year that ends in March.

headline.main: In Rapid Turnaround, Toyota Is on Track to Post Record Earnings
headline.print_headline: In Rapid Turnaround, Toyota Is on Track to Post Record Earnings
